tool_description: The Internet Archive Wayback Machine supports a number of different APIs to make it easier for developers to retrieve information about Wayback capture data.
name: Wayback Machine
title: Wayback Machine

api_list.name: Availability
api_list.description: This simple API for Wayback is a test to see if a given url is archived and currenlty accessible in the Wayback Machine. This API is useful for providing a 404 or other error handler which checks Wayback to see if it has an archived copy ready to display. The API can be used as follows:

optional_parameters.name: timestamp
optional_parameters.description: timestamp is the timestamp to look up in Wayback. If not specified, the most recenty available capture in Wayback is returned. The format of the timestamp is 1-14 digits (YYYYMMDDhhmmss)

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: callback is an optional callback which may be specified to produce a JSONP response.
